speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: SCENE II. The palace.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Enter LADY MACBETH and a Servant

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Is Banquo gone from court?

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Ay, madam, but returns again to-night.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Say to the king, I would attend his leisure

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: For a few words.

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Madam, I will.

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Exit

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Nought's had, all's spent,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Where our desire is got without content:

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: 'Tis safer to be that which we destroy

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Than by destruction dwell in doubtful joy.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Enter MACBETH

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: How now, my lord! why do you keep alone,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Of sorriest fancies your companions making,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Using those thoughts which should indeed have died

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: With them they think on? Things without all remedy

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Should be without regard: what's done is done.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: We have scotch'd the snake, not kill'd it:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: She'll close and be herself, whilst our poor malice

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Remains in danger of her former tooth.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: But let the frame of things disjoint, both the

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: worlds suffer,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Ere we will eat our meal in fear and sleep

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: In the affliction of these terrible dreams

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: That shake us nightly: better be with the dead,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Whom we, to gain our peace, have sent to peace,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Than on the torture of the mind to lie

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: In restless ecstasy. Duncan is in his grave;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: After life's fitful fever he sleeps well;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Treason has done his worst: nor steel, nor poison,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Malice domestic, foreign levy, nothing,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Can touch him further.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Come on;

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Gentle my lord, sleek o'er your rugged looks;

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Be bright and jovial among your guests to-night.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: So shall I, love; and so, I pray, be you:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Let your remembrance apply to Banquo;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Present him eminence, both with eye and tongue:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Unsafe the while, that we

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Must lave our honours in these flattering streams,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And make our faces vizards to our hearts,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Disguising what they are.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: You must leave this.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: O, full of scorpions is my mind, dear wife!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Thou know'st that Banquo, and his Fleance, lives.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: But in them nature's copy's not eterne.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: There's comfort yet; they are assailable;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Then be thou jocund: ere the bat hath flown

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: His cloister'd flight, ere to black Hecate's summons

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The shard-borne beetle with his drowsy hums

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Hath rung night's yawning peal, there shall be done

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: A deed of dreadful note.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: What's to be done?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Be innocent of the knowledge, dearest chuck,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Till thou applaud the deed. Come, seeling night,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Scarf up the tender eye of pitiful day;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And with thy bloody and invisible hand

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Cancel and tear to pieces that great bond

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Which keeps me pale! Light thickens; and the crow

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Makes wing to the rooky wood:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Good things of day begin to droop and drowse;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: While night's black agents to their preys do rouse.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Thou marvell'st at my words: but hold thee still;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Things bad begun make strong themselves by ill.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: So, prithee, go with me.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Exeunt
